channel.title: Plotting on Matt Barstead's Research, Blog, & Repository
channel.description: Recent content in Plotting on Matt Barstead's Research, Blog, & Repository

item.title: RMarkdown is the Most Powerful Codebook Maker You Can Find for Your Datasets
item.description: You worked hard to collect, clean, and process your data. Now you dataset is finally ready for finalization step. That put a bow on it and send it to all your colleagues phase. That moment when you release a deep sigh of relief at the end of the hard (sometimes underappreciated) work of data wrangling. Now you have to make something that communicates all that you have done. A dataset is often only as good as its documentation.

item.title: Interaction Plots with Continuous Moderators in R
item.description: Long ago (the first half of my grad school life), I created a model for a manuscript I submitted. The paper was focused on adolescentsâ€™ appraisals of their relationships with their mothers, fathers, and best friends. Specifically, I wanted to test whether the association between different motivations for social withdrawal (i.e., removing oneself from social activities and interactions) and internalizing symptoms varied as a function of perceived support in any one (or all three) of these relationships.
